findings.interpretation: The dayside is warm, but this value alone is not decisive evidence against a bare surface interpretation.
The positive transport estimate favors non-zero heat redistribution beyond an immediate bare-rock reradiation limit.
Thermal-energy balance fits suggest the planet is very dark rather than highly reflective.

findings.metric: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate
findings.interpretation: A spectral feature near 15 Âµm is consistent with atmospheric CO2 absorption.

findings.metric: Joint fit likelihood ratio (atmosphere vs no atmosphere)
findings.interpretation: Atmospheric retrieval families explain the combined phase-curve and spectral products better than no-atmosphere models.

findings.metric: Preferred pressure scale in CO2-rich retrieval family
findings.interpretation: A moderate-pressure atmosphere remains plausible in the CO2-rich branch.

controls_or_null_results.statement: A pure no-atmosphere model cannot simultaneously match both phase amplitude and spectral band behavior.
O2-rich atmosphere cases are not fully ruled out by current data.
